content: You will next receive a multiple-choice question, each with five options: A, B, C, D, and E respectively. Please provide your answer as a single letter option (your response should contain only one letter as the answer and no other text).

Question: What can machines do that humans cannot?
Options: A. fail to work B. perform work C. answering questions D. see work E. fly

Option B is correct. Machines can perform work that humans cannot, such as driving a car, operating machines, playing musical instruments, etc. Machines can also perform repetitive tasks more efficiently and with greater precision than humans. On the other hand, humans have a higher level of creativity and adaptability that machines lack, which limits their ability to perform certain tasks. Therefore, humans still have an edge over machines in some tasks.

Question: What can machines do that humans cannot?
Options: A. fly B. see work C. answering questions D. perform work E. fail to work

All of the options are correct. Machines can perform work that humans cannot, such as driving a car, operating machines, playing musical instruments, etc. Machines can also perform repetitive tasks more efficiently and with greater precision than humans. On the other hand, humans have a higher level of creativity and adaptability that machines lack, which limits their ability to perform certain tasks. Additionally, machines cannot fly, see work, or fail to work like humans can. Therefore, humans still have an edge over machines in some tasks.
